description: a(1) = 2; a(n) is the smallest prime > a(n-1) such that a(n) + a(n-1) is a square.
links: Harry J. Smith and Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 1000 terms by Harry J. Smith)
example: The next term after 7 is 29 as 7 + 29 = 36 = 6^2.
mathematica: nxt[n_]:=Module[{np=NextPrime[n]},While[!IntegerQ[Sqrt[n+np]],np = NextPrime[ np]]; np]; NestList[nxt,2,40] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 28 2013 *)
prog: (PARI) { a=2; for (n=1, 1000, a1=a; if (n>1, until (issquare(a + a1), a=nextprime(a + 1))); write("b062064.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 31 2009
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jun 12 2001
